<p style="text-align:justify"> I am a Professor of Financial Econometrics in the Brandeis International Business School. My research interests include time-series econometrics, Bayesian econometrics, asset allocation, portfolio optimization, and econometric methods in finance. I serve as an associate editor for the [Journal of Financial Econometrics](http://jfec.oxfordjournals.org/). At Brandeis University, I teach econometrics at the undergraduate and graduate levels, as well as Financial Economics. </p>
